extendedIngredients.name: avocado oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup avocado oil (or vegetable oil, or any cooking oil)

extendedIngredients.aisle: Nut butters, Jams, and Honey;Health Foods
extendedIngredients.name: honey
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/4 cup honey (or agave, to make this vegan)

extendedIngredients.name: mango
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 mango, peeled, pitted, and julienned (or diced)

extendedIngredients.name: ramen noodles
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 (3-ounce) packages of ramen noodles, crumbled (you will not use the seasoning packet)
metaInformation: (you will not use the seasoning packet)

extendedIngredients.name: salt and pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: pinch of salt and black pepper

recipes.title: Crunchy Asian Ramen Noodle Salad (a.k.a. Basically the Best Potluck Salad EVER)

winePairing.pairingText: Riesling, Sake, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Ramen Noodles. Sak√© is an obvious choice when it comes to Japanese food. If you want to stick to grape wine, though, you might opt for sauvignon blanc or riesling. The Max Ferdinand Richter Graacher Dompropst Riesling Kabinett with a 4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 32 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Max Ferdinand Richter Graacher Dompropst Riesling Kabinett

recipes.instructions: To Make The Salad:(Optional first step: Heat oven to 425 degrees. Spread the crumbled ramen noodles and sliced almonds out on a baking sheet, and stir a bit to combine. Bake for about 5 minutes, or until the almonds and noodles are slightly toasted and golden. Remove baking sheet, and give the mixture a good stir to toss. Then return it to the oven and toast for an additional 3 minutes. Keep a very close eye on the mixture so that it does not burn. Remove and set aside.)Add ingredients (including the vinaigrette) together in a large bowl, and toss until combined.Serve immediately, or cover and refrigerate for up to 3 days. (This salad is much better eaten the first day, as the noodles lose their "crunch" the longer it sits, and the avocado may brown a bit. Still, it's perfectly edible and enjoyable even after a few days!)To Make The Vinaigrette:Whisk all ingredients together until combined.

analyzedInstructions.name: To Make The Salad(Optional first step

steps.step: Spread the crumbled ramen noodles and sliced almonds out on a baking sheet, and stir a bit to combine.
Bake for about 5 minutes, or until the almonds and noodles are slightly toasted and golden.
Remove baking sheet, and give the mixture a good stir to toss. Then return it to the oven and toast for an additional 3 minutes. Keep a very close eye on the mixture so that it does not burn.
Add ingredients (including the vinaigrette) together in a large bowl, and toss until combined.

analyzedInstructions.name: Serve immediately, or cover and refrigerate for up to 3 days. (This salad is much better eaten the first day, as the noodles lose their "crunch" the longer it sits, and the avocado may brown a bit. Still, it's perfectly edible and enjoyable even after a few days!)To Make The Vinaigrette

steps.step: Whisk all ingredients together until combined.
